keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

byline.contributor: Karam Shoumali contributed reporting from Izmir, Turkey, and Ceylan Yeginsu from Canakkale, Turkey.

lead_paragraph: For Europe, a new deal with Turkey offers its best chance to contain a crisis, but for migrants there is a sense that Europe, so welcoming last summer, is betraying them, and that Turkey is benefiting on the backs of their misery.

headline.print_headline: Migrants Lament Deal as a Betrayal by Europe
headline.main: Migrants Lament as Deal With Turkey Closes Door to Europe

snippet: For Europe, a new deal with Turkey offers its best chance to contain a crisis, but for migrants there is a sense that Europe, so welcoming last summer, is betraying them, and that Turkey is benefiting on the backs of their misery.
abstract: Migrants attempt to cross Aegean Sea and enter Greece as agreement between European Union and Turkey blocking their passage goes into effect, but many are intercepted; refugees from war-torn Syria, Iraq and Afghanistan see deal as benefiting Turkey and Europe at their expense.
